sentences.en: a symbol of Arab courage, to be venerated for generations
sentences.cn: 受到世代尊崇的阿拉伯人勇气的象征

sentences.en: And love , young man, love and venerate the ideal.
sentences.cn: 青年人啊,热爱理想, 崇敬理想吧.

sentences.en: And love, young men, and venerate the ideal.
sentences.cn: 青年人啊,热爱理想吧, 崇敬理想吧.

sentences.en: Most Italians venerate the name of Dante.
sentences.cn: 大多数意大利人崇拜但丁的名字.

sentences.en: The good thing is he is the kind of person I respect or more specifically, venerate.
sentences.cn: 不过还好,他是我所尊重或者说崇拜的.

sentences.en: They came to venerate him as a symbolic figure.
sentences.cn: 他们把他当作偶像来崇拜.

sentences.en: They venerate the old man's memory.
sentences.cn: 他们怀着崇敬之情纪念那位老人.

sentences.en: To consider or treat with profound awe and respect; venerate.
sentences.cn: 尊敬,崇敬,敬畏:带着深切的敬畏或尊重来考虑或对待; 崇敬.

sentences.en: To crush fanaticism to venerate the infinite, such is the law.
sentences.cn: 压制热狂,崇敬无极, 这才是正道.

sentences.en: We were taught to venerate the glorious example of our heroes and martyrs.
sentences.cn: 我们受到教导要崇敬英雄、烈士的光辉榜样.

words.tran_cn: 庄严的，值得尊敬的；珍贵的

trans.tran_en: to honour or respect someone or something because they are old, holy, or connected with the past
